21 SECTION 1. Arkansas Code Title 6, Chapter 16, Subchapter 1, is amended
22 to add an additional section to read as follows:
23 6-16-156. Perils of communism education — Required — Definition.
24 (a) Beginning with the 2024-2025 school year, education concerning the
25 perils of communism and autocratic governments shall be taught in all public
26 schools in a manner that generates an understanding of the following results
27 of communism and autocratic governments:
28 (1) The record of mass murder and oppression committed as a
29 result of communism and autocratic governments;
30 (2) The economic structures and related collapses of the
31 economic structures in countries that have adopted communist policies;
32 (3) The issues and failures associated with communist economic
33 systems; and
34 (4) The continued failure of communism and autocratic
35 governments resulting from the direct influences of:
36 (A) The Union of Soviet Socialist Republics and its

3 (C) Democratic People's Republic of Korea; and
4 (D) Argentina.
5 (b) The State Board of Education, in consultation with local,
6 statewide, and national experts in communism and autocratic government
7 education, shall develop and distribute grade-appropriate curricula,
8 standards, materials, and units relating to the perils of communism and
9 autocratic governments for grades seven through twelve (7-12) in all public
10 schools.
11 (c) As used in this section, “communism and autocratic government"
12 means a system of government in which absolute power over a state is
13 concentrated in the hands of a single person or party, whose decisions are
14 subject to neither external legal constraints nor regularized mechanisms of
15 popular control.
